Class CashierService

java.lang.Object
services.CashierService
public class CashierService extends Object
Service layer for cashier-side operations in the POS system.

Provides JDBC-based data access to menu items, orders, toppings, recipes, inventory adjustments, employees, and customers. Methods in this class are invoked by JavaFX controllers to retrieve data and persist user actions.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    CashierService.Employee
    Lightweight employee entity used by UI code paths that do not require the full Employee model.
    static class 
    CashierService.EmployeeData
    DTO representing a single employee row's current UI state.

    • getMenuItems

      public ArrayList<MenuItem> getMenuItems()
      Retrieves all menu items ordered by ID.
      Returns:
      a list of MenuItem objects, or null if an error occurs

    • getNextOrderId

      public int getNextOrderId()
      Retrieves the next available order ID (max(id) + 1) from the database.
      Returns:
      the next order ID, or -1 if unavailable

    • getNextOrderItemId

      public int getNextOrderItemId()
      Retrieves the next available order item ID (max(id) + 1) from the database.
      Returns:
      the next order item ID, or -1 if unavailable

    • getTotalOrderPrice

      public Double getTotalOrderPrice(ArrayList<OrderItem> orderItems, ArrayList<ArrayList<Topping>> toppings)
      Computes the total order price by summing item prices (scaled by size) and topping prices.
      Parameters:
      orderItems - the list of order items in the order
      toppings - a parallel list of topping lists, one per order item
      Returns:
      the total price for the current order

    • getIdFromMenuName

      public int getIdFromMenuName(String name)
      Looks up the MenuItem ID by exact name.
      Parameters:
      name - the menu item name
      Returns:
      the menu item ID, or -1 if not found

    • getNameFromMenuId

      public String getNameFromMenuId(int id)
      Looks up the MenuItem name by ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the menu item ID
      Returns:
      the menu item name, or null if not found

    • getPriceFromMenuId

      public Double getPriceFromMenuId(int id)
      Looks up the MenuItem price by ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the menu item ID
      Returns:
      the price, or -1.0 if not found

    • getToppings

      public ArrayList<Topping> getToppings()
      Retrieves all available toppings.
      Returns:
      a list of Topping objects, or null if an error occurs

    • sendOrder

      public boolean sendOrder(Order order, ArrayList<OrderItem> orderItems, ArrayList<ArrayList<Topping>> orderItemToppings)
      Persists the given order, order items, and item toppings in a single transaction, then updates inventory based on the resulting consumption.
      Parameters:
      order - the Order to persist
      orderItems - the list of OrderItem entries to persist
      orderItemToppings - parallel list of topping lists per order item
      Returns:
      true if the transaction committed successfully; false otherwise

    • getAllRecipeInventoryItems

      public ArrayList<String> getAllRecipeInventoryItems()
      Retrieves the distinct inventory items (name and unit) that are referenced by any recipe.
      Returns:
      a list of inventory item labels in the form "name unit"

    • getMenuItemIngredients

      public ArrayList<javafx.util.Pair<String,Double>> getMenuItemIngredients(int menuItemId)
      Retrieves ingredient quantities for a specific menu item. Items that are not part of the consumable recipe (e.g., cups, lids, straws) are filtered out.
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the menu item identifier
      Returns:
      a list of pairs in the form ("name (unit)", quantity) for display/editing

    • updateMenuItem

      public boolean updateMenuItem(MenuItem menuItem)
      Updates the name and price of an existing MenuItem.
      Parameters:
      menuItem - the menu item with updated fields
      Returns:
      true if at least one row was affected; false otherwise

    • addMenuItem

      public boolean addMenuItem(String name, double price)
      Creates a new MenuItem with the next available ID.
      Parameters:
      name - the new menu item name
      price - the new menu item price
      Returns:
      true if the insert succeeded; false otherwise

    • updateRecipeQuantities

      public boolean updateRecipeQuantities(int menuItemId, ArrayList<javafx.util.Pair<String,Double>> ingredientQuantities)
      Upserts recipe rows for a menu item based on the provided ingredient quantities. For each inventory item, updates quantity if positive, deletes the recipe row if zero, or inserts a new row if it does not exist.
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the menu item identifier
      ingredientQuantities - pairs of ("name (unit)", quantity) to persist
      Returns:
      true if the transaction completed; false if it rolled back or failed

    • deleteMenuItem

      public boolean deleteMenuItem(int menuItemId)
      Deletes a menu item and its associated recipe rows within a single transaction.
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the identifier of the menu item to delete
      Returns:
      true if the menu item was removed; false otherwise

    • deleteEmployee

      public boolean deleteEmployee(int employeeId)
      Deletes an employee by identifier.
      Parameters:
      employeeId - the employee ID
      Returns:
      true if at least one row was deleted; false otherwise

    • getEmployees

      public ArrayList<CashierService.Employee> getEmployees()
      Retrieves all employees ordered by manager status (managers first) then ID.
      Returns:
      a list of Employee records from the database

    • getNextEmployeeId

      public int getNextEmployeeId()
      Computes the next available employee identifier (max(id) + 1).
      Returns:
      the next employee ID, or 1 if none exist

    • addEmployee

      public boolean addEmployee(int id, String name, boolean isManager)
      Inserts a new employee record.
      Parameters:
      id - the employee identifier to assign
      name - the employee's display name
      isManager - whether the employee has manager privileges
      Returns:
      true if the insert succeeded; false otherwise

    • updateEmployee

      public boolean updateEmployee(int id, String name, boolean isManager)
      Updates an existing employee's name and manager flag.
      Parameters:
      id - the employee identifier
      name - the updated display name
      isManager - the updated manager flag
      Returns:
      true if at least one row was updated; false otherwise

    • saveEmployeeChanges

      public boolean saveEmployeeChanges(ArrayList<CashierService.EmployeeData> employeeChanges)
      Saves multiple employee records (inserts/updates) in a single transaction.
      Parameters:
      employeeChanges - the list of employee changes to persist
      Returns:
      true if the transaction committed successfully; false otherwise

    • findCustomer

      public Customer findCustomer(String email)
      Looks up a registered customer by email.
      Parameters:
      email - the customer's email address
      Returns:
      the matching Customer, or a sentinel with ID -1 if not found

    • addCustomerPoints

      public boolean addCustomerPoints(int customerId, double subtotal)
      Adds reward points to a customer's account proportional to the order subtotal (1 point per dollar).
      Parameters:
      customerId - the customer identifier
      subtotal - the order subtotal used to compute points
      Returns:
      true if the update succeeded; false otherwise

    • getCustomerPoints

      public int getCustomerPoints(int customerId)
      Retrieves the current reward points for a customer.
      Parameters:
      customerId - the customer identifier
      Returns:
      the number of points, or -1 if not found

    • registerCustomer

      public int registerCustomer(String email, String name)
      Registers a new customer by email and name if the email does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      email - the customer's email address
      name - the customer's display name
      Returns:
      the new customer ID, or -1 if the email already exists or on error

    • defaultTea

      public int defaultTea(int menuItemId)
      Returns the default tea type for the specified menu item. By convention: 1 = Black, 2 = Green, 3 = Oolong.
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the menu item identifier
      Returns:
      the default tea inventory ID, or -1 if not found

    • getMenuItemByNameAndPrice

      public MenuItem getMenuItemByNameAndPrice(String name, double price)
      Retrieves a menu item matching the given name and price (useful to obtain the ID after insertion).
      Parameters:
      name - the menu item name
      price - the menu item price
      Returns:
      the matching MenuItem, or null if not found
